intro: Navarretia spicata, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are slender and grass-like, and it produces small, white or pale pink flowers that attract pollinators. Navarretia spicata is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
